channel.title: Comments on: SP2010 Branding Tip #2 â€“ Custom Master Pages and Dialog Boxes

item.title: By: webwmn
item.dc:creator: webwmn
item.description:
I used a width of 60% and it worked and also used .ms-dialog #s4-v4body also allowed me to remove the background image and go with white. Resolved.
thanks
item.content:encoded:
I used a width of 60% and it worked and also used .ms-dialog #s4-v4body also allowed me to remove the background image and go with white. Resolved.

thanks

item.title: By: webwmn
item.dc:creator: webwmn
item.content:encoded:
How does this work in a V4 master that is mostly customized by an attached CSS file?

I used a V4 master to create a system master customized by css. The modal window is now very wide. When I used “s4-notdlg” in the body container, the site went to full width and the scroll bar didn’t work. I tried using your modal script here but it didn’t work.

.ms-dialog #s4-bodyContainer {
margin:0px !important;
width:auto !important;
height:auto !important;
padding: 0px !important;
}

item.title: By: Mahesh
item.dc:creator: Mahesh
item.description: Thanks a lot. This was what I was looking for. Helped me a lot.
item.content:encoded: Thanks a lot. This was what I was looking for. Helped me a lot.

item.title: By: Clem
item.dc:creator: Clem
item.description: Keep in mind, using a custom master in SP2010 will kill people picker fields and lookup columns in lists. Since the custom master will render in IE9, the switch back to IE8 for NewForm.aspx and EditForm.aspx does not happen. It's a known bug which renders the use of custom master pages useless in SharePoint.
item.content:encoded: Keep in mind, using a custom master in SP2010 will kill people picker fields and lookup columns in lists. Since the custom master will render in IE9, the switch back to IE8 for NewForm.aspx and EditForm.aspx does not happen. It’s a known bug which renders the use of custom master pages useless in SharePoint.

item.title: By: Marie
item.dc:creator: Marie
item.content:encoded:
I used the class=”s4-notdlg” in those divs but I am getting dialog boxes that are empty, just have just the background of my custom page, no content in them.

I looked at the padding, height and width of my wrapper (container) and there is nothing that seems to interfere:
.wrapper {
width: 1060px;
background: #fff;
margin: 0 auto;
}

I don’t know why I am getting empty dialog boxes. Can you help?

Marie

item.title: By: larry
item.dc:creator: larry
item.description: I have created a custom master page. the problem I am having in my dialogs are I am missing the images in the top right to close or resize. I cant figure out where to make the change to have them visible again. Any help would be greatly appreciated
item.content:encoded: I have created a custom master page. the problem I am having in my dialogs are I am missing the images in the top right to close or resize. I cant figure out where to make the change to have them visible again. Any help would be greatly appreciated

item.title: By: Randy Drisgill
item.dc:creator: Randy Drisgill
item.description: I might need to see a screenshot of whats going on. I have seen instances where you need to add extra CSS to get rid of padding and widths from custom branding that are applying to dialogs. I'm not sure if this is what you mean buf for that I add CSS like this (customBody is my main page container):<br /><br />.ms-dialog .customBody {<br /> margin:0px !important;<br /> width:auto !important;<br /> height:auto !important;<br /> padding: 0px !important;<br />}
item.content:encoded:
I might need to see a screenshot of whats going on. I have seen instances where you need to add extra CSS to get rid of padding and widths from custom branding that are applying to dialogs. I’m not sure if this is what you mean buf for that I add CSS like this (customBody is my main page container):

.ms-dialog .customBody {
margin:0px !important;
width:auto !important;
height:auto !important;
padding: 0px !important;
}

item.title: By: wonderwoman
item.dc:creator: wonderwoman
item.description: Randy, can you check this out in firefox? Cory is right - firefox does not resize properly. If you have a solution, please let me know.
item.content:encoded: Randy, can you check this out in firefox? Cory is right – firefox does not resize properly. If you have a solution, please let me know.

item.title: By: Randy Drisgill
item.dc:creator: Randy Drisgill
item.description: class="s4-notdlg" goes in every div that you don't want to show in a dialog box. Common places would be the logo, navigation, and footer.
item.content:encoded: class=”s4-notdlg” goes in every div that you don’t want to show in a dialog box. Common places would be the logo, navigation, and footer.
